name: homogametic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having gametes (= cells connected with sexual reproduction, either male sperms or female eggs) that have the same sex chromosome: In humans, the female is the homogametic sex, with a pair of X chromosomes, and the male is heterogametic, with an X and a Y chromosome.
More examplesFewer examplesIn birds, moths, and butterflies, the male of the species has homogametic sex chromosomes (denoted by ZZ) and the female has heterogametic chromosomes (ZW).The study investigates the effect of sex chromosome constitution on the development in embryos from homogametic and heterogametic females of the mouse species.
